Ask HN: What are some high probable outcomes cause by tech layoffs
text:
Just saw that Microsoft will be laying off 10k+ employees.

Layoffs.fyi indicates ( filter: location :- Bay Area, date:- > last 380 days) about 60k people have been layed off in the last year. That does not include the Microsoft number.

I am curious about what the hive mind here thinks are the high probable short and long term effects of having so many unemployed people in such a high cost of living area? How will it shape the Bay Area for the next 1,3 and 5 years.

Ask HN: What are typical web tech used for data science coaching websites?
text:
Hi HN,

I have very little idea about web development so this might be a naive question. Often I visit coding and data science coaching platforms that are everywhere these days (e.g., codeacademy). I wonder what kind of web technologies drive these. Relatedly, if one wants to build such a website, what expertise are required?

Ask HN: What orgs have a good track record stopping abuse by the US Government?
text:
I was thinking about it, and most everyone that has criticized the US government have quietly disappeared after the news cycle is over. Every whistleblower gets arrested or escapes to another country. Julian Assange and Wikileaks has been entirely dismantled and stopped at this point. The groups that remain will complain in a news segment and deliver nothing else. The incumbent advantage in democracy has kept politicians in charge that don’t ask for serious change.

Ultimately, many social problems are never addressed. Does the U.S. government have any effective check and balance?

How to vet an untrusted open-source project?
text:
Sometimes you may want to use some software in your project, but the maintainer(s) may have some functional affiliation(s) that makes it difficult to use without significant security assessment effort.

Example here: GlobalProtect is VPN software from Palo Alto Networks, but the maintainer of this open source client is based in China. He may be a fine, upstanding person, the code may be pristine, but there's systemic risk that needs to be bought down.

What are your tools of choice to assess something like this?

https://github.com/yuezk/GlobalProtect-openconnect
